Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a cream-coloured pottery jar, the fabric is relatively coarse and partially pale-red in section, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and very faint traces of at least five lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394307) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394307)
